title: 崩坏3视觉小说 PSP移植游戏发布
content:
大家好，我是History_exe。历时3年多，终于兑现了自己之前的承诺。
我已经将崩坏3的官方视觉小说《逆熵Anti-Entropy》全章节成功移植到了PSP上。不仅如此，我还一并完成了视觉小说《幽兰黛尔》的移植。本次一次性发布两款移植游戏。
移植初衷崩坏3是一款优秀的游戏，我清楚地记得，在崩坏3问世的时候，市场上充斥的大量卡牌、回合制中等质量游戏，能拿得出手的游戏很少。崩坏3以其极高水准的制作横空出世。作为一名普通玩家，我有幸通过崩坏3结识了一群朋友，十分感谢崩3。同时作为一名游戏爱好者，我尤其喜欢掌机游戏。因为其便携性和无需联网的性质可以随时随地玩耍，不受任何人限制。当时崩坏3出现了一种新形势的载体——视觉小说。我立刻就有了一个想法，如果能在掌机上玩到这款视觉小说那该有多好……
为此，我查阅了大量资料，翻遍了国内外的论坛。找寻能给PSP做游戏的“游戏引擎”，一开始什么都不懂，没有编程知识，甚至什么是游戏引擎都没有概念。幸运的是，在我尝试了大量的工具之后，我在某个论坛找到了一个合适的引擎（哪个论坛我忘记了），并且我甚至联系到了引擎的原作者。这个引擎就是PGM引擎，准确的来说应该是PGM开发库。而其作者就是白枫。
原作游戏介绍《逆熵Anti-Entropy》《逆熵Anti-Entropy》全章节26章，故事讲述了逆熵组织的起源，主人公瓦尔特由于其特殊的体质被迫周转于天命各个实验室被人体实验，机缘巧合之下，被转移至帝国第42实验室，本应该继续当小白鼠的他，在这里他的人生迎来了巨大的转折……

《幽兰黛尔》《幽兰黛尔》全章节31章，与之前的《逆熵Anti-Entropy》相比，人物数量更多，剧情更丰富。故事发生在《逆熵Anti-Entropy》之后，主人公比安卡和副官丽塔，奉命前往世界泡中调查。在调查过程中，她和副官丽塔结识了很多新伙伴，旅途中一路化解困难。但旅途中也不全是一帆风顺，随着她们旅程的进行，她们也在一点一点地靠近这个世界的真相，未知的敌人在暗处窥视….

title: PGM Simple Tutorial
content:
PGM Simple Tutorial beta 0.9 by History_exe
Blog：https://history-exe.github.io/
PGM Simple Tutorial1. For the beginningWhat is PGM?​        PGM, the full name of Pocket Game Maker, was developed by 白枫 of 「掌机开发者之家」. The original intention was to make a game similar to “Ace Attorney“. But now it is mainly used to transplant AVG and visual novel games.




​        There are many games transplanted by PGM, and most of the existing PSP AVG transplanted games are made by PGM. The author of this tutorial, I (History_exe) also used PGM to transplant miHoYo’s Honkai3rd visual novels 《Anti-Entropy》 and 《Durandal》. For the relevant download address, please refer to my blog (https://history-exe.github.io/)








​        PGM is written in lua language and provides external ports. You can add code to make the engine more suitable. Among them, the more famous version of the variations is the one I have used. Its name is PocketGameMaker-ConvertedEdition- (I called is as PGM CE version). This magic variation adds 4 simple weather systems and the function of hiding dialog boxes. Because it is considered to transplant AVG games, the following tutorials are based on the variation.
​        There are many engines related to PGM. The following table details the features of each variation:



Engine name
Engine description
The latest version of the engine



AMP
Old version engine
v0.75


PGM—Pocket Game Maker
Cross-platform RPG engine, the non-modified version of PGM (AMP) engine used now is based on this
The author has abandoned the project


PGM(AMP)
It is a new version of AMP engine, which is derived from PGM—Pocket Game Maker
v0.83, the author stated that the source code of the program has been lost, so the engine cannot be developed


PGM CE
The PGM CE engine is developed based on PGM (AMP) and is a fully functional AVG engine
v0.83



Build The PGM Environment
Download and unzip the PGM CE version to the location you think is suitable. It is usually recommended to put it on a disk with a larger space, but not to put it on the desktop. My root directory for this tutorial is \PGM_CE.
Open the folder and click the install.bat file to install the necessary files for the trial operation of PGM_CE on the computer. (This action will copy the files in \PGM_CE\tools\winxp_dll to the PGM_CE\bin directory, if not automatically copied, you can manually copy the files to the PGM_CE\bin directory)
Under \PGM_CE\src\user, use the notebook program that comes with the computer to open the first.ev file. (The .ev file is a special script file for PGM, but it is essentially a text file and can be edited and saved with any text editing software.)
Copy the following code to the first.ev file and save the text in GB2312 mode.

allclear()	--Clear the occupied memory
msgboxon()	--Show text background frame

text("Hello, PGM.")	--This code will display Hello, PGM with black font color.
textcl()	--This code is used to clear the text after displaying the previous sentence






Click pack.bat under the \PGM_CE folder, and then click run.bat. If the text: Hello, PGM. appears successfully, the environment configuration is complete. 
 
 

 Note: pack.bat is used to pack resource files that do not include scripts, such as pictures, and run.bat is specifically used to pack resource files.

Folder introductionRoot directory introduction




bin folder: store non-picture script resources (including background music, character voices, fonts, sound effects and videos)

src folder: store scripts and image resources.

tools folder: Some tools of PGM.

install.bat: batch process to copy the dll necessary for PGM into the bin folder.

pack.bat: batch processing, if you change files other than the text script, you must repack it. The insurance practice is to pack after making changes.

run.bat: Test the game. After clicking it, you can view the running effect of the game on the PC. Two windows will be generated, one is the debug window of cmd, and the other is the game running window.

更新内容.txt：PGM CE version is modified based on PGM, some commands are different from PGM, this text records some basic commands of PGM CE version.

目录介绍.txt：In PGM, the placement of certain files is specified in detail. This text briefly records the file level of the PGM CE version and the role of different folders.
**Reminder: Try not to place other irrelevant files or project files in the root directory to prevent confusion about which files are necessary when publishing the game. **



Folder hierarchy introduction​    The detailed functions of each folder are as follows:
[根目录]
├bin folder
│├ data folder		--Resource folder (mainly where audio, video, and font files are stored)
││├ bgm folder		--Background music folder
││├ sound folder		--Sound Effect Folder
││├ voice folder		--Voice folder
││├ video folder		--Video folder (currently only supports pmp format)
││├ font folder		--Font folder
││├ system folder		--System folder
││├ (gmcode.bin)		--Script package file (click run.bat to generate)
││└ (gmdata.bin)		--Picture package file (click pack.bat to generate)
│├ engine.sys		--Engine master file
│├ pgm.ini		--Engine configuration file
│├ win32main.exe	--Run the program on the PC
│└ (PGMSAVEDATA)	--Archive folder (automatically generated)
├src folder	--Resource folder (mainly where pictures and script files are stored)
│├file folder		--Picture folder (pictures must be stored here)
││├bg folder			--Background folder
││├fg folder			--Figure folder
││├rule folder		--Matte folder
││├title folder		--Title folder
││├gallery folder		--Gallery folder
│││├cg folder			--Game CG folder
│││├thumb folder			--CG thumbnail folder (thumbnail file name is limited to "thumb_" + CG file name)
│││└CGlist.lua			--CG list (CG used for registration)
││├system folder		--System folder
││├menu folder		--Menu folder
││├saves folder		--Archive folder
││└user folder		--User folder
│├system folder	--System script folder (do not modify without authorization)
│├user folder		--User script folder
││└first.ev			--Text script
│├am_start.ev		--User script main entrance
│├ce_init.lua		--User parameter setting file
│└KeySetting.lua	--Button function setting file
├tools folder	--Collection of useful tools
├install.bat	--Configure the operating environment (users who use this engine for the first time, please run it first)
├pack.bat	--Pack game resources (updated picture materials must be repackaged)
└run.bat	--Debug game (includes packaging script function)


Recommended text editing software​        The games that PGM can make/transplant are mainly text-based, so it is very important to choose a good text editing software.
Visual Studio Code（Linux/Windows）
​        For PGM, which only requires text editing, Visual Studio Code is sufficient, as the heavy-duty Visual Studio is completely unnecessary.
**NotePad++**（Linux/Windows）
​        NotePad++ is also a good choice for people who are pursuing more refreshing and simple. If you can set the custom code highlighting of NotePad++ by yourself, it will be even more powerful for transplantation.

Picture processing software recommendationGimp（Linux/Windows）
​        Open source image processing software, download and use. No need to crack, no need to worry about viruses. If you need to use the batch processing function, you need to download the plug-in.
Photoshop（Windows）
​        Well-known image processing software, if you can use the original, just use Photoshop directly.

Video editing software recommendation​        Maybe your project involves video, there are many video editing software, here is only a brief introduction.
Shotcut（Linux/Windows）
​        Open source video editing software, download and use.
​        I haven’t fully understood Shotcut. I only used the functions of converting frame pictures into videos, cutting and splicing videos, and adding or subtracting music to videos, but these functions are enough.
完美者转码（Windows）
​        This software can transcode video files in general formats into pmp format video dedicated to PSP, which is a format dedicated to in-game video in PSP.

Program script and Text script​        The text files in PGM are roughly divided into two categories: program scripts and text scripts.
Program script: It is mainly the encapsulation of some codes of PGM, most of which are in .lua format, which are actually lua scripts and generally do not need to be changed.
Text script: The text script file is what we need to write from scratch, and its format is .ev format. It is also very simple to create a file in this format. You only need to create a new text file in .txt format, and then rename it to a .ev file. It is best to use the text editing software provided above, because the text script file There are also specific requirements for encoding, that is, the encoding format must be GB2312.

2. Basic usageShow dialogue​        Dialogue is the soul of word games, and learning how to display dialogue is the foundation of all.
Display textThe method of displaying text is as follows:
​        You can freely change the content in double quotes. It should be noted that the text encoding format must be GB2312, and both English and Chinese are entered in half-width format, otherwise the displayed text is garbled.
​        PGM uses lua language to encapsulate system scripts. In text script files and program script files, the way to add comments is similar to that of lua language, and single-line comments use “--“.
allclear()	--Clear the occupied memory
msgboxon()	--Show text background frame

--Simply display a sentence
text("This is a sentence")
textcl()

--Show a sentence with the character's name
text("Character name","the words said")
textcl()

allclear()：This command can clear the occupied memory. This command must be written at the beginning of each text script. In addition, this command is also a panacea command. When the game is stuck in the process of PPSSPP or PSP real machine verification, you can try to add this command before the stuck position to reserve enough memory. PSP stuck bugs are generally due to insufficient memory.
msgboxon()：The command to display the text background frame. Under normal circumstances, this command only needs to be used once in the text script, and the text background box will always be displayed. In special circumstances, you need to close the text background box and use the msgboxoff() command.
text()：Command to display text. You can display a dialogue without an appointed narration or a character with a character’s name. It should be noted that the text to be displayed in this command needs to be enclosed by English double quotes.
If the dialogue contains a character’s name, both the character’s name and the content of the dialogue must be enclosed in English double quotation marks and separated by an English comma.
textcl()：Clear the last sentence from the screen, can also be used as a close text command. Under normal circumstances, each dialogue needs to have this command in the next line. If you want to achieve the display effect of two or more sentences, you can achieve text continuity without using textcl() after the corresponding dialogue.

Color label​        In the text dialog of PGM, the standard format of the color label is [c=FFFFFF]...[/c], where “FFFFFF” represents the hex value of the color, which can be replaced by yourself, without limitation on upper and lower case, but without “ #”.
​        In a conversation, you can use multiple color tags, the color tags can be nested and you can set the text to be specified color at will, an example is as follows:
allclear()
msgboxon()

--Display multiple colors of text in one sentence
text("[c=FF0000]红[/c][c=00FF00]绿[/c][c=0000FF]蓝[/c]")
textcl()

--Character names can also be specified in specific colors, color tags are nested, and the text to be specified in the color can be set arbitrarily
text("[c=DDCAB3]丽塔[/c]","麻烦的[c=FF0000]事[/c]交给我，不能脏了您的手。")

The display effect is as follows:








​        Color labels are optional in PGM. Not every sentence has to be colored. PGM has a fixed position to globally set the font color.

Show background​        PGM supports three image formats: jpeg, png and bmp. However, the horizontal and vertical resolution of a single picture cannot exceed 512 pixels. This is due to the PSP’s own hardware constraints and cannot be changed. Loading images with a horizontal or vertical resolution of more than 512 will cause the PSP to crash during the actual test.
​        In PGM, most resources need to be numbered for displaying and playing. There are only two background pictures, namely 1 or 2; there are 32 numbers for vertical pictures, but some special numbers are blocked. It is reserved for displaying related pictures of the system, and the reserved number will be explained in detail later.
​        The coordinate origin of the picture in PGM is the upper left corner of the picture. When two pictures overlap, you can use the layer concept in the image processing software to understand. The picture with the larger number is overlaid on the picture with the smaller number. The background picture, that is, bg is at the bottom, the text is at the top, and the figure drawing is in the middle, and the text dialog box is between the text and the figure drawing.
The hierarchical relationship of background, figure drawing, text dialog box, and text is shown in the picture below:









Show background image​        The background picture is lower than the figure drawing picture at the layer level, that is to say, the background picture will be displayed below the figure drawing picture when displayed.
The command to display the background image is as follows:
--Show background image
_bg(number,file,effect,time)
bgxy(number,dx,dy)
bgon(number)

The above command can display a background picture, where:
first row:
_bg(number,file,effect,time)：It means to load a picture. The picture has been loaded into the memory, but it is not displayed.
_bg：The command to load the background picture. The picture displayed by this command is better and will not cause the picture to appear “water ripples”. By default, “IMG_8888” is enabled.
number：Represents the layer number, bg can only have two layer numbers, namely 1 or 2. In the three lines of commands to display the background, the number of the picture is the same.
file：It represents the full file name of the background image you want to load, including its format, and you also need to put quotation marks, for example: “bg_01.jpg”.
effect：Represents the effect number, there are 6 in total: 0, displayed immediately, no effect; 1, fade in; 2, fade out; 3, shake; 4, matte (clockwise); 5, matte (counterclockwise).
time：Represents the duration of the effect. In PGM, 1000 is 1 second. Bg generally fades in and fades out at 1000.
IMG_XXXX：This variable is not required. You can set the display quality. The _bg command defaults to IMG_8888, and IMG_8888 represents the highest quality display.
second line:
bgxy(number,dx,dy)：It means where you want to display the loaded picture on the screen. If you do not use this command when displaying the background picture, the background picture will be loaded to the position (0,0) by default.
bgxy：Set the position on the screen where you want to display the background image
number：Represents the layer number. The layer number here needs to be consistent with the layer number in the _bg command.
dx、dy：Represents the horizontal and vertical coordinates of the position where you want to display the picture.
The third row:
bgon(number)：Show picture commands.
bgon：This command is a display picture command. Without this command, the picture will not be displayed.
number：Represents the layer number. The layer number here needs to be consistent with the layer number in the _bg command.

Close background image​        There are two commands to close the background image, bgoff() and bgnull(). The following explains the similarities and differences between the two commands:
--Turn off the background image, but do not clear it in the memory.
bgoff(number)

--Close the background picture and clear the picture in the memory.
bgnull(number)

number：Represents the number of the background image you want to close.
bgoff：Commands are mostly used to temporarily turn off the background image and do not need to clear the background image. Pictures closed by this command do not need to be reloaded to be displayed again by the bgon command. The application scenario can be a situation where the background image is turned off, no background image is displayed, and then the background image needs to be displayed again.
bgnull：The command is to close the picture and clear the picture in the memory at the same time. It can effectively prevent the memory from bursting when the image is loaded too much. Therefore, I will use bgnull to close the background image in most cases.

Show Figure painting​        Figure painting, refers to the character painting. But sometimes there are other uses, such as the need to display some special font text, which cannot be covered by GB2312 encoding. At this time, you can edit the special text you want to display as a picture and display it in the PGM in the form of a picture.
Show figure picture--Show figure picture
_fg(number,file,effect,time)
fgxy(number,dx,dy)
fgon(number)

first row:
_fg(number,file,effect,time)：It means to load a figure picture. The picture has been loaded into the memory, but it is not displayed.
This command can also add the option of IMG_8888 to improve the image quality of the figure picture, but the effect of the image quality improvement is only obvious when the figure picture has a transparent channel, which can effectively eliminate the “water ripple” phenomenon. The added code is “_fg(number,file,effect,time,IMG_8888)“, which will increase the memory usage, so please be careful when using it.
number：Represents the layer number, fg has 32 layer numbers, but some numbers may be occupied by some system pictures. In the three-line command to display the picture, the number of the picture is the same.
file：It represents the full file name of the figure picture you want to load, including its format, and you also need to bring quotation marks, for example: “fg_01.jpg”.
effect：Represents the effect number, there are 6 in total: 0, displayed immediately, no effect; 1, fade in; 2, fade out; 3, shake; 4, matte (clockwise); 5, matte (counterclockwise).
time：Represents the duration of the effect. In PGM, 1000 is 1 second. fg generally fades in and fades out at 200.

Close figure pictureThere are two commands to close the figure picture, fgoff() and fgnull(). For the similarities and differences between the two commands, please refer to bgoff() and bgnull().

Play video​        PGM can also play video, but it has special requirements for the video format. PGM only supports video in pmp format, which is a unique video format of Sony PSP. Please see my blog post for details on its make method.
​        Due to the characteristics of PGM, if you do not play the video before playing the audio, playing the audio is invalid. Simply put, if you need to play audio in your transplanted game, you must play the video once at the beginning of the entire project. Only in this way can the audio be effective.
--Play video
video(file)


Play audio​        PGM supports audio files in wav and mp3 formats. Support for playing 2 mp3 and 4 wav at the same time. Different formats usually have different usages. The audio in PGM can be divided into three categories: background music, sound effects, and character voice.
​        Usually background music uses mp3 format audio, and sound effects and character voice use wav format audio.

Play audioThe code example is as follows:
--Play background music
bgm(file)

--Play sound
sound(file)

--Play character voice
voice(file)

​        Although the above bgm, sound and voice commands are not numbered, their default numbers are all 1. The audio number is required when the playback is stopped.

Stop playing audio​        Generally, only the background music needs to be stopped. Because the sound effects and character voice generally do not need to be stopped during playback.
--Stop playing background music
bgmstop(number)

--Stop playing sound effects
soundstop(number)

--Stop playing character voice
voicestop(number)

​        Audio is a large part of the PGM resource, and the memory occupies a large part. The used audio must be cleared from the memory in time. The sound effect generally takes up a small amount, has little effect, and does not need to be cleared. After the character’s voice is played, it will be cleared automatically.
--Clear background music
bgmnull(number)


Pack files into ISOPackaging method
Enter the PGM_CE\tools folder, unzip the PGM.v0.83 main engine file.zip compressed package, enter the PSP(ISO) folder, unzip the UMDGen.zip compressed package, and open The software UMDGen.exe, due to localization, may be falsely reported as a virus by the anti-virus software.

Copy the EBOOT.PBP file in PSP(PBP) into the PSP(ISO)\PSP_GAME\SYSDIR folder.

Drag the PSP_GAME folder into the box on the right.



Enter the SYSDIR folder in the UMDGen software

Copy the data folder, engine.sys, and pgm.ini files in the bin directory of the PGM_CE project to the SYSDIR folder.






The final state before packaging is as follows:



Click the save button to save in ISO format, and the packaging is complete.





Notice:1 The saved ISO file name cannot be Chinese or Japanese, but must be English or English plus numbers, which is a limitation of the PSP system. Otherwise, the packaged game will not be displayed in the PSP.
2 The two pictures in the PSP_GAME folder can be replaced with other pictures, but the file name (including case) and picture resolution cannot be changed.
​        Need to modify the picture into the PSP_GAME folder. in:
​        ICON0.PNG  Small icon when selecting the game
​        PIC1.PNG  the background image when selecting the game





3. Intermediate usageTitle interface and menu interfaceTitle interface​        The title interface refers to the position where the player selects the game function after the game starts. The title interface of a general game mainly contains several options: “Start Game“, “Read Archive“, “CG/Music Appreciation“ and “Exit Game“, etc. Options. Not all of these options are fixed, but the option “Start Game“ must be present, otherwise the player cannot play the game.





Title interface configuration file​        There are no fixed requirements for the file configuration location and name of the title interface, but I generally configure the title interface separately as a title.ev file and place it in the src\user folder, together with the text script. After this setting, the logical sequence of reading the text of the PGM game is basically:




The startup process is explained in detail below:

After starting the game, the system reads the configuration information in am_start.ev, and generally configures some promotional information or game startup animation before the game starts in the am_start.ev file. Then jump to title.ev.

Set the UI parameters of the title interface in title.ev, such as the position of each button, and the background image and background music of the title interface. Set the action after it is executed at the start game button. Generally, click to start the game and enter the text script directly.

01.ev, 02.ev, etc. are text scripts, and the relationship between the text scripts can be in a line sequence, or branches can be set between the text scripts. After the last chapter of the final text script is executed, you need to return to am_start.ev.



Explanation of title interface parametersThe option setting is more complicated, the following is an example to explain:




The above interface composition mainly includes background image, game options, and background music. The overall configuration file is as follows:
stageclear()
allclear()

speakmode(speak_mode_sample)

--Set title tag
*title
_bg(1,"backTitle.jpg",0,200)
bgxy(1,0,0)
bgon(1)

bgm("theme.mp3")
mp3volume(1,200)

--Set heading branch
*title_select
SET_TITLE_COORD(330,100,0,28)
SET_TITLE_BUTTON("title_start.png","title_load.png","title_album.png","title_thanks.png","title_quit.png")
drawtitle(*newgame,*load,*album,*thanks,*exit)

--Label: New Game
*newgame
allclear()
jump("01.ev")

--Tag: read archive
*load
drawload()
goto(*title_select)

--Label: Appreciation Mode
*album
bgnull(1)
drawsfind("cg_find_page_1.lua")

--Label: Thanks interface
*thanks
allclear()
jump("thanks.ev")

--Label: Quit the game
*exit
QUIT()




System part
stageclear()
allclear()

speakmode(speak_mode_sample)

stageclear()：It can clear all loaded data and restore the default data.
allclear()：Clear background pictures and figure drawings.
speakmode(speak_mode_sample)：Dialogue mode, the parameter speak_mode_sample represents the simple dialogue mode, and it is neither automatic nor skip mode.

Title tag
--Set title tag
*title
_bg(1,"backTitle.jpg",0,200)
bgxy(1,0,0)
bgon(1)

bgm("theme.mp3")
mp3volume(1,200)

*title：Set a label as title to facilitate subsequent jump use.
mp3volume(1,200)：Set the volume of mp3 playback locally, the “1” in the parameter represents the mp3 with audio number 1; the “200” in the parameter represents the volume value you want to set, the larger the value, the greater the volume.

Title branch settings
​        Here is the key to displaying the game title interface options. SET_TITLE_COORD sets the approximate position and step size of the options; SET_TITLE_BUTTON sets the picture resources of the relevant options; drawtitle completes the designation of the option tags.
--Set heading branch
*title_select
SET_TITLE_COORD(330,100,0,28)
SET_TITLE_BUTTON("title_start.png","title_load.png","title_album.png","title_thanks.png","title_quit.png")
drawtitle(*newgame,*load,*album,*thanks,*exit)

*title_select：The title branch is set.
SET_TITLE_COORD(330,100,0,28)：The parameter “330” is the abscissa of the option group on the screen; the parameter “100” is the ordinate of the option group on the screen. Parameter “0” is the displacement of the focus in the horizontal direction when selecting between options, and zero means vertical up and down displacement; when the parameter “28” is selected between the options, the displacement of the focus in the vertical direction represents up and down displacement The step is 28 pixels.
SET_TITLE_BUTTON("title_start.png","title_load.png","title_album.png","title_thanks.png","title_quit.png")：Corresponding image resources are set for the options of the title interface, and the number and order of them need to be consistent with the drawtitle() command below.
drawtitle(*newgame,*load,*album,*thanks,*exit)：Set the total number of options and their order in the title interface.

New game tag
--Label: New Game
*newgame
allclear()
jump("01.ev")

*newgame：Start the game tag, where the tag name needs to be consistent with drawtitle().
jump("01.ev")：Jump between scripts, jump to 01.ev, after executing the start game, it will jump to the 01.ev text script and start the game.

Read archive tag
**Reading archives are basically in the following fixed format, and most cases do not need to be modified. **
--Tag: read archive
*load
drawload()
goto(*title_select)

*load：Read the archive tag, where the tag name needs to be the same as in drawtitle().
drawload()：Call the fixed command of the file reading interface.
goto(*title_select)：Jump within the script, jump to the specified label.

Appreciation Mode Label
​        Appreciation mode is more difficult to understand and requires multiple debugging to get satisfactory results. More detailed content about the Appreciation Mode will be explained in Chapter 4 Advanced Usage.
--Label: Appreciation Mode
*album
bgnull(1)
drawsfind("cg_find_page_1.lua")

*album：Appreciation mode label, where the label name needs to be consistent with drawtitle().
bgnull(1)：Clear the background picture, clear the background picture of the title menu before entering the appreciation mode, to avoid the influence of longevity. The parameter “1” means to clear the background picture whose picture parameter is 1.
drawsfind("cg_find_page_1.lua")：Use PGM’s “survey mode” to realize the appreciation function.

Thanks interface
​        The thank you interface is optional, but all my transplanted works include this interface. In this interface, I would like to express my gratitude to those who have helped me, write some feelings about transplantation, and leave my own contact information.
--Label: Thanks interface
*thanks
allclear()
jump("thanks.ev")

*thanks：Thanks to the interface label, where the label name needs to be consistent with drawtitle().
jump("thanks.ev")：To jump between scripts, I usually create a separate text for the thank you interface.

Exit the game
​        The option to quit the game is indispensable and must be included. Generally, the following format can be used without modification.
--Label: Quit the game
*exit
QUIT()

*exit：Exit the game tag, where the tag name needs to be consistent with drawtitle().
QUIT()：PGM’s exit game command.

Title interface option picture​        The option picture can automatically switch to display another image when the focus is moved to this option, so that the highlight effect can be achieved when the focus is on this option.




To achieve this effect, a picture example is as follows:








​        You need to put the pictures you want to display when the option is not selected on the upper part, and put the pictures you want to display when the option is selected on the lower part.

Menu and system interfaceMenu interface configuration file​        If you need to change the layout of the options on the interface, such as adding or deleting options, you need to process the interface script. The interface script is located in the src folder, and the file name of the configuration file is ce_init.lua. This file can be opened directly with any text editor.
After opening, the main configuration that can be changed is as follows:

Game information
​        The first is the game information part. Changes to this part will affect the external properties of the game, such as game name, game version, game save details, number of game saves, game save method, and system sound options.
-- ================================================================
-- game msg var
-- ================================================================
-- If you want to use the psp official archive, GAME_NAME must not exceed 12 characters
GAME_NAME = "PGMCE"
GAME_VERSION = 1.0
GAME_MSG = "PocketGameMaker-ConvertedEdition-"
GAME_SAVELISTSIZE = 8
GAME_SAVEMODE = PGMPSP
CreatePGMSaveFolder()

DEFAULT_SOUND = "system/nil.wav"
CERTAIN_SOUND = "system/certain.wav"
CANCEL_SOUND = "system/cancel.wav"

GAME_NAME：This option is the game name. If you want to change the game name in the PSP official save mode, the changed name cannot exceed 12 characters. But the game name can not only be set here, the game name can also be changed in the SFO file of the game
GAME_VERSION：Game version, the version number of the game can be set here. It can also be set in the SFO file of the game.
GAME_MSG：Game archive information, the information displayed here is a remark to the archive each time it is archived, which is used to distinguish archives. However, the technology is limited, and in this tutorial I did not know how to dynamically set this information. The setting of “PocketGameMaker-ConvertedEdition-“ here is static. When there are multiple archives, from the outside, each archive is the same, which does not play a role in distinguishing archives.
GAME_SAVELISTSIZE：Number of game saves, here you can set the maximum number of game saves, the default is 8. If you think the number is not enough, you can set it yourself.
GAME_SAVEMODE：Archive method, there are two optional archive methods.

PSP official archive mode: Set this to PGMPSP, which is the official archive mode of PSP. Generally, the games I transplant use this mode;

PGM archive mode: Set this to PGMPC, and use PGM’s internal archive.


**CreatePGMSaveFolder()**：The function of the system to create archives can not be changed here!
DEFAULT_SOUND：Except for the sound effects of the “OK” and “Cancel” buttons in the game, you can change it yourself.
CERTAIN_SOUND：The sound effect of the OK button in the game can be changed by yourself.
CANCEL_SOUND：The sound effect of the cancel button in the game can be changed by yourself.

Dialog settings
​        The settings for the dialog box mainly include: the dialog box picture, the number of layers in the dialog box, the abscissa of the dialog origin and the ordinate of the dialog origin.
-- Dialog settings
MSGBOX = "msgbox01.png"
MSGBOX_NUM = 10
MSGBOX_DX = 0
MSGBOX_DY = 272-116

MSGBOX：Dialog box picture, here you can set which picture is used as the dialog box. The picture here is displayed in IMG_8888 mode, which supports a transparent channel.
MSGBOX_NUM：The number of layers in the dialog box. The dialog box belongs to the fg category from the picture category, that is to say, it belongs to the figure drawing. The specific layer can be determined by yourself. I personally recommend setting it between 20 and 25, so that it can be given in a single chapter Sufficient layers are reserved for the character drawing (when set to 20, more than 10 layers are reserved for the character drawing), and layers are reserved for other functions.
MSGBOX_DX：The abscissa of the origin of the dialog box. Set the number of pixels in the horizontal distance from the origin of the dialog box to the edge of the screen.
MSGBOX_DY：The ordinate of the origin of the dialog box. Set the number of pixels in the vertical distance from the origin of the dialog box to the edge of the screen.

Name setting
​        The name here refers to the display position of the character’s name in the dialogue involving the character’s name in the game text script.
-- Name setting
MSGNAME_NUM = 32
MSGNAME_DX = MSGBOX_DX+65
MSGNAME_DY = MSGBOX_DY+33-DIALOG_FONT_HEIGHT

MSGNAME_NUM：The number of layers of character names is set to 32 by default.
MSGNAME_DX：The abscissa of the origin of the character’s name. The default setting is to offset 65 pixels to the right from the abscissa of the origin of the dialog box. The advantage of this setting is that there is a fixed distance between the name and the dialog box, which is easy to adjust. The character’s name is generally on the upper left of the dialog box. When the coordinates of the origin of the dialog box are changed, the coordinates of the origin of the name will also move together, forming a binding state between the two, and there will be no misplacement of the dialog box and the name. .
MSGNAME_DY：The ordinate of the origin of the character’s name, the default setting is based on the ordinate of the origin of the dialog, minus the height of the dialog text and offset downward by 33 pixels. The ordinate about the origin of the name can be set by yourself, and different games have different arrangements.

Dialog text setting
​        The dialogue text is the text that is wrapped by text() in the text script and needs to be displayed during the game. The options that can be set are: the abscissa of the origin of the dialog text, the ordinate of the origin of the dialog text, the maximum number of characters in a single line of the dialog text, and the maximum number of lines of the dialog text.
-- Dialog text setting
MSGTEXT_DX = MSGBOX_DX+35
MSGTEXT_DY = MSGBOX_DY+40
MSGTEXT_LINELEN = 50
MSGTEXT_LINEMAX = 3

MSGTEXT_DX：The abscissa of the origin of the dialog text is offset by 35 pixels to the right on the basis of the abscissa of the origin of the dialog by default.
MSGTEXT_DY：The ordinate of the origin of the dialog text is offset by 40 pixels from the ordinate of the origin of the dialog by default.
MSGTEXT_LINELEN：The maximum number of characters in a single line of dialogue text, the default is 50, that is, a single line can display a maximum of 50 characters, and the text exceeding 50 will automatically switch to the next line for display. It is recommended to make adjustments according to the game.
MSGTEXT_LINEMAX：The maximum number of lines of dialog text, the default is 3. The maximum number of lines of dialog text for a single display. If the amount of text in a single time is too large and all three lines cannot be displayed at once, the screen will be automatically cleared and the remaining text will be displayed in the next dialog.

Figure drawing parameter setting
​        The following can be used as variables, assign values here uniformly, and then use them in scripts.
-- Figure drawing parameter setting
FG_CENTER_DX = 0
FG_CENTER_DY = 0
FG_LEFT_DX = -120
FG_LEFT_DY = 0
FG_RIGHT_DX = 120
FG_RIGHT_DY = 0
FG_MOST_LEFT_DX = -240
FG_MOST_LEFT_DY = 0
FG_MOST_RIGHT_DX = 240
FG_MOST_RIGHT_DY = 0
FG_BACK_DX = 0
FG_BACK_DY = 0

FG_CENTER_DX、FG_CENTER_DY：The horizontal and vertical coordinates when the figure drawing is displayed in the middle.
FG_LEFT_DX、FG_LEFT_DY：The horizontal and vertical coordinates when the figure drawing is displayed on the left.
FG_RIGHT_DX、FG_RIGHT_DY：The horizontal and vertical coordinates when the figure drawing is displayed on the right.
FG_MOST_LEFT_DX、FG_MOST_LEFT_DY：The horizontal and vertical coordinates when the figure drawing is displayed on the far left, the far left is more to the left than the left.
FG_MOST_RIGHT_DX、FG_MOST_RIGHT_DY：The horizontal and vertical coordinates when the figure drawing is displayed on the far right, the far right is further to the right than the right.
FG_BACK_DX、FG_BACK_DY：When the vertical pictures are displayed in the middle, the purpose of setting this parameter is to deal with the situation that some games have stacked vertical pictures.

Effect transition time setting
​        The corresponding way of time in PGM is: 1000 is 1 second.
-- Effect transition time setting
BG_FADETIME = 800
FG_FADETIME = 600
MSGBOX_FADETIME = 300
QUAKE_FADETIME = 500
BGM_FADETIME = 800

BG_FADETIME：The transition time for the background image to fade out.
FG_FADETIME：The transition time for the fading out of the vertical picture.
MSGBOX_FADETIME：The fade out transition time of the text background frame.
QUAKE_FADETIME：The fade-out transition time of the vibration effect.
BGM_FADETIME：The fade-out transition time of background music.

Font information setting
​        The font setting here is the global font setting.
-- ================================================================
-- font msg constant var
-- ================================================================
FONT = "fz.ttf"
FONTSIZE = 11
FONTCOLOR = MAKE_RGBA_4444(0,0,0,255)
FONTWIDTH = 16
FONTHEIGHT = 18
am_font_getinstance()

FONT：Font, you can specify the font you want to use here. Only ttf format fonts are supported.
FONTSIZE：Font size.
FONTCOLOR：Font color, here you can set the font color globally. For RGBA format, just change the parameters in the brackets.
FONTWIDTH：Font width.
FONTHEIGHT：The height of the font.
am_font_getinstance()：Read the above settings. If the above settings are out of date elsewhere, they will not be read. That is to say, the instruction is invalid, that is, you cannot set FONT_PATH, FONT_SIZE, FONT_COLOR in other places. If you want to change it elsewhere and can read it, you need to modify the script.

Dialog related settings
​        DIALOG_ICON and DIALOG_AUTO_ICON refer to these two icons respectively.




​        Among them, DIALOG_ICON is special. You can set an animation for it. A series of dynamic pictures need to be spliced horizontally into one picture. As shown in the figure below, if you want to customize other pictures, it is recommended to keep the size of the picture consistent with the example. The total size is 384X24, and the picture animation needs to be set to 12.






-- ================================================================
-- dialog module constant var
-- ================================================================
DIALOG_ICON = "win_wait_a.png"
DIALOG_ICON_SPEED = 50
DIALOG_ICON_DX = 410
DIALOG_ICON_DY = 258
DIALOG_ICON_SIZE = 22
DIALOG_AUTO_ICON = "auto_icon.png"
DIALOG_AUTO_ICON_DX = 0
DIALOG_AUTO_ICON_DY = 0
DIALOG_AUTO_ICON_TICK = 350
DIALOG_AUTO_TICK = 2000
DIALOG_SOUND = DEFAULT_SOUND

DIALOG_ICON：Dialogue icon, specify the corresponding image resource file.
DIALOG_ICON_SPEED：Control the animation speed of the dialog icon.
DIALOG_ICON_DX、DIALOG_ICON_DY：It is presumed to be the maximum limit position of the dialogue icon, because the display position of the dialogue icon is automatically determined according to the end of the dialogue.
DIALOG_ICON_SIZE：The size of the dialog icon.
DIALOG_AUTO_ICON：Automatic mode indicator icon, specify the corresponding picture resource file.
DIALOG_AUTO_ICON_DX、DIALOG_AUTO_ICON_DY：The automatic mode indicates the position of the icon.
DIALOG_AUTO_ICON_TICK：The automatic mode indicates the refresh rate of the icon.
DIALOG_AUTO_TICK：The speed of the conversation in automatic mode.
DIALOG_SOUND：The sound effect when the dialogue is loading. Here is “DEFAULT_SOUND”, DEFAULT_SOUND has been set in other locations, so it can be directly quoted.

Function menu setting
​        The function menu refers to the menu that completes the basic functions of the game. Basic functions include: SKIP (skip mode), AUTO (automatic mode), LOAD (read file), SAVE (save) and QUIT (exit the game).
​        The call-up method can be used to click on the upper part of the game window with the mouse, or it can be called up by the B button of the keyboard.




-- ================================================================
-- menu module constant var
-- ================================================================
MENU_BOX = "menu_box.png"
MENU_BOX_DX = 142
MENU_BOX_DY = -8
MENU_ICON = "hand_icon01.png"
MENU_ICON_DX = 170
MENU_ICON_DY = 78
MENU_ICON_STEP_DX = 0
MENU_ICON_STEP_DY = 26
MENU_BUTTON = {"menu_skip.png","menu_auto.png","menu_load.png","menu_save.png","menu_quit.png"}
MENU_BUTTON_DX = 210
MENU_BUTTON_DY = 80
MENU_BUTTON_STEP_DX = 0
MENU_BUTTON_STEP_DY = 26
MENU_BUTTON_COUNT = 5
MENU_SOUND = DEFAULT_SOUND
MENU_CONTROL_MODE = 2  -- 1-Left and right control、2-Up and down control

MENU_BOX、MENU_BOX_DX、MENU_BOX_DY：I don’t know what these three items are. I haven’t found the original picture and haven’t used this setting. It is recommended not to move, keep it as it is.
MENU_ICON：The option indicator icon is the hand icon pointing to the right in the figure above.
MENU_ICON_DX、MENU_ICON_DY：The options indicate the horizontal and vertical coordinates of the initial position of the icon.
MENU_ICON_STEP_DX、MENU_ICON_STEP_DY：The option indicates the step size of the icon.
MENU_BUTTON：Function button, the picture resource corresponding to the function button can be set here, please pay attention to the order. If you want to change the picture resource, it is recommended to directly name the picture you want to use as the name in the setting, and try not to change the setting and rename it.
MENU_BUTTON_DX、MENU_BUTTON_DY：The initial horizontal and vertical coordinates of the function button.
MENU_BUTTON_STEP_DX、MENU_BUTTON_STEP_DY：The step size of the function button.
MENU_BUTTON_COUNT：The number of function buttons.
MENU_SOUND：The sound of the function buttons.
MENU_CONTROL_MODE：Function button control mode.

If set to “2”, the arrangement of the 5 buttons is arranged in a row up and down.

If set to “1”, the 5 buttons are arranged in a row on the left and right.



Branch line menu setting
​        When the game progresses to a certain stage, there may be situations that require the player to make a choice. Depending on the choice, the game text may also be different, this is the side menu.
-- ================================================================
-- ramus module constant var
-- ================================================================
RAMUS_ICON = "hand_icon02.png"
RAMUS_ICON_DX = 120
RAMUS_ICON_DY = 74
RAMUS_ICON_STEP_DX = 0
RAMUS_ICON_STEP_DY = 35
RAMUS_BUTTON_BG = "ramus_bg.png"
RAMUS_BUTTON_BG_DX = 60
RAMUS_BUTTON_BG_DY = 60
RAMUS_BUTTON_DX = 94
RAMUS_BUTTON_DY = 68
RAMUS_BUTTON_STEP_DX = 0
RAMUS_BUTTON_STEP_DY = 35
RAMUS_BUTTON_ICON_MODE = 2
RAMUS_SOUND = DEFAULT_SOUND

RAMUS_ICON：The branch line indicator icon indicates which option is currently selected.
RAMUS_ICON_DX、RAMUS_ICON_DY：The branch line indicates the initial horizontal and vertical coordinates of the icon.
RAMUS_ICON_STEP_DX、RAMUS_ICON_STEP_DY：The branch line indicates the step size of the icon.
RAMUS_BUTTON_BG：The branch line option background, the processing method of this background is consistent with the processing method of “title interface option picture”. The upper part of the picture is unselected, and the lower part of the picture is selected.




RAMUS_BUTTON_BG_DX、RAMUS_BUTTON_BG_DY：The horizontal and vertical coordinates of the branch line option background.
RAMUS_BUTTON_DX、RAMUS_BUTTON_DY：The horizontal and vertical coordinates of the branch line option.
RAMUS_BUTTON_STEP_DX、RAMUS_BUTTON_STEP_DY：The step size of the branch line option.
RAMUS_BUTTON_ICON_MODE：The mode of the branch line indicator icon is the same as the “function button control mode”. Set “2” to move up and down, and set “1” to move left and right.

Game system setting menu​        In PGM, the game system setting menu mainly contains the following functions: “Set background music size”, “Set background sound effect size” and “Set reading speed”. The reading speed set here refers to the display speed of the game text in normal mode.
​        This menu can also be set by itself, but the current energy is limited, and there is no research on how to set it.





Tag jump​        PGM can implement the function of setting tags in a text script and then jumping to a specific tag. This function is mostly used in selected locations, such as different progress in the game according to different options, or title menus.
The commands for label jump are as follows:
--Label jump command
goto(*lable01)

......  --The dots here represent other content in the text script
......  --The dots here represent other content in the text script
......  --The dots here represent other content in the text script

*lable01  --Label position to jump to

​        After using the label jump command in the text script, the program will directly skip the content between goto(*lable01) and *lable01, and any content between the two will not be executed.

Script jump​        Script jump refers to “jump between text scripts” or “jump between program script and text script”. But in most cases, the former has more application scenarios.
​        Jump between text scripts. When there is too much content in the game, you can split the game text script into different chapters. When jumping from the previous chapter to the next chapter, you need to use the script jump command.
--Script jump command
jump(file)

--The command after the jump command will not be executed by the program, because it is already in the next script.
text("This sentense will not be displayed.")

​        In most cases, this command will be used at the end of the text script, because once this command is executed, the program will jump to the specified text script instead of executing the command after the command in the current script.

Branch options--Branch option code
drawramus("Branch option 1",*lable01","Branch option 2",*lable02)

*lable01
text("You have chosen option one")
textcl()

*lable02
text("You have chosen option two")
textcl()

Multiple branch options can be used.

Literary paintingto be continued

Picture matteto be continued

4. Advanced usageScript processing​        Generally speaking, visual novel games are dominated by text, and the amount of text is huge. Manual editing and proofreading are often inconvenient, so learning some processing methods will have the effect of getting twice the result with half the effort. The ones I use most in the porting process are regular expressions and python crawlers. Regular expressions are used the most, while python crawlers are mainly used to obtain text for some special games.
Regular expression​        Please learn about the specifics of regular expressions by yourself. Here are some common usages of text processing, and only provide methods for processing text using regular expressions.

Example 01: Add code at once before each line, using the ^ symbol.








Example 02: Add code all at once at the end of each line.







​        There are more uses, regular expressions are a very important tool.

Variable usageto be continued

CG Appreciation Mode​        The mainstream CG appreciation modes in PGM are divided into 2 categories:

Hot zone version: The joystick is mainly used to control cursor movement and click on CG thumbnails. This method is more common in the transplant works of 任天之浪, suitable for beginners.

NewScene version: Mainly use buttons to realize the CG appreciation function. This method is more common in the transplant works of 沁ぅ纯の宝贝, but it requires a variety of complicated logic and codes to complete the CG appreciation, but the related tutorials have been lost.


to be continued

Music Appreciation Mode​        PGM can also create an appreciation mode for music, but none of my transplanted works currently has a music appreciation mode, and this mode needs to be studied.

5. Debug​        Learning how to debug is especially important in the process of game production and porting.

PGM简单教程一、新手上路什么是PGM​        PGM，全称为Pocket Game Maker，是由「掌机开发者之家」的白枫开发。最初制作的意愿是为了能自制类似“逆转裁判”的游戏。但现在被主要用来移植AVG类、视觉小说类游戏。




​        使用PGM移植的游戏有很多，现存的PSP移植游戏绝大多数都是使用PGM移植的。本教程的作者，也就是我（History_exe）也使用PGM移植了miHoYo的崩坏3视觉小说《逆熵Anti-Entropy》和《幽兰黛尔》。相关下载地址详见我的博客（https://history-exe.github.io/）








​        PGM是由lua语言编写而成，对外提供端口，可以自行添加代码对引擎进行”魔改”。其中比较著名的魔改版本也是我所使用过的魔改版本。其名称为**PocketGameMaker-ConvertedEdition-**（可简称为PGM CE版），此魔改版添加了4种简易的天气系统和隐藏对话框的功能。因为考虑到是移植AVG游戏，所以以下教程均以魔改版为基础进行讲解。

搭建PGM环境
下载并解压PGM CE版到你认为合适的位置。通常建议放到空间比较大的盘里，不建议放在桌面。本教程我的根目录为\PGM_CE。
打开文件夹，点击install.bat文件去安装PGM_CE在电脑上试运行的必要文件。（此动作会复制\PGM_CE\tools\winxp_dll内的文件到PGM_CE\bin目录下，如果没有自动复制，可以手动将文件复制到PGM_CE\bin目录下）
在\PGM_CE\src\user下，使用电脑自带的记事本程序打开first.ev文件。（.ev文件，是PGM专用的脚本文件，但其本质上还是文本文件，可以使用任何文本编辑软件进行编辑和保存。）
复制下面的代码到first.ev文件内，并保存文本。

allclear()	--清空被占用的内存
msgboxon()	--显示文字背景框

text("Hello, PGM.")	--此代码将显示字体颜色为黑色的Hello, PGM.
textcl()	--此代码作用为在显示完上一句话之后清除文字






点击\PGM_CE文件夹下的pack.bat，再点击run.bat。 如果成功出现文字：Hello, PGM. 则环境配置完毕。
 
 
 

 注：pack.bat用来打包图片等不包括脚本的资源文件，run.bat专门用来打包资源文件。

文件夹介绍根目录介绍




bin文件夹：存放非图片脚本资源（包括背景音乐、人物语音、字体、音效和视频）

src文件夹：存放脚本、图片资源。

tools文件夹：PGM的一些工具。

install.bat：将PGM必须的dll复制进bin文件夹的批处理

pack.bat：批处理打包，若更改除剧情脚本之外的文件之后，必需要重新打包。保险做法是作出更改之后就打包。

run.bat：测试游戏，点击后可在PC端查看游戏运行效果，会产生两个窗口，一个是cmd的debug窗口，另一个是游戏运行窗口。

文本编辑软件推荐​        PGM所能制作/移植的游戏主要以文字为主，因此选好文本编辑软件很重要。
Visual Studio Code（Linux/Windows平台）
​        对于PGM这种只需要文本编辑的方式，Visual Studio Code足矣，像是重型的Visual Studio完全不需要也用不上。
**NotePad++**（Linux/Windows平台）
​        对于追求更清爽简单的人来说，NotePad++也是一个不错的选择，如果你会自己设置NotePad++的自定义代码高亮，那对于移植来说简直是如虎添翼。

图片处理软件推荐Gimp（Linux/Windows平台）
​        开源的图像处理软件，下载即用。无需破解，不用担心病毒。若需要使用批处理功能，则需要下载插件。
Photoshop（Windows平台）
​        知名图像处理软件，如果你可以使用正版，那直接使用Photoshop就好。

视频编辑软件推荐​        或许你的项目涉及到了视频，视频编辑软件有很多，这里仅简单介绍。
Shotcut（Linux/Windows平台）
​        开源的视频编辑软件，下载即用。
​        Shotcut我还没有完全用明白，仅使用到了将帧图片转为视频、裁减拼接视频和给视频增减音乐的功能，但这些功能已经足矣。

程序脚本和剧情脚本​        PGM中的文本文件大致分为两大类：程序脚本和剧情脚本。
程序脚本：主要是PGM一些代码的封装，其格式大多数为.lua格式，其实就是lua脚本，一般不需要更改。
剧情脚本：剧情脚本文件是我们需要从零开始写的，其格式为.ev格式。创建此格式的文件也十分简单，只需要新建一个.txt格式的文本文件，之后重命名，改为.ev文件即可，最好使用上面提供的文字编辑软件，因为剧情脚本文件对编码还有特定要求，即编码格式必须为GB2312。

二、基础用法显示对话​        对话，是文字类游戏的灵魂，学会如何显示对话是基础中的基础。
显示文字显示文字的方法如下：
​        你可以自由更改双引号里的内容。需要注意的是文字编码格式必须是**GB2312**，且英文和中文全部为半角输入，否则显示出来的文字是乱码。 
​        PGM使用lua语言进行系统脚本封装，在剧情脚本文件和程序脚本文件中，其添加注释的方式与lua语言类似，单行注释使用“--”。
allclear()	--清空被占用的内存
msgboxon()	--显示文字背景框

--简单显示一句话
text("这是一句话")
textcl()

--显示一句话的同时附带人物名字
text("人物名字","说的话")
textcl()

allclear()：此命令可以清空被占用的内存。每个剧情脚本的开头一定要写此命令。此外，这个命令也是万金油命令，当游戏在PPSSPP或者PSP实机验证过程中出现卡死的bug，可以尝试在会卡死的位置前添加此命令以预留足够内存。PSP的卡死bug一般都为内存不足。
msgboxon()：显示文字背景框的命令。此命令在一般情况下只需在剧情脚本中使用一次，文字背景框便会一直显示。特殊情况需要关闭文字背景框使用msgboxoff()命令。
text()：显示文字的命令。可以显示不带有任命的旁白或者带有人物名字的人物对话。需要注意，本命令中要显示的文字都需要被英文双引号包括。
如果对话带有人物名字，人物名字和其对话内容都分别需要英文双引号包括，且之间需要有一个英文逗号隔开。
textcl()：将上一句话从屏幕清除，也可作为关闭文字命令使用。正常情况下，每个对话都需要在下一行带有这个命令，若想实现两句话或者多句话的接续显示效果，则可以在相应对话后不使用textcl()，即可达成文字连续显示效果。

颜色标签​        PGM的文字对话中，颜色标签标准格式为[c=FFFFFF]...[/c]，其中“FFFFFF”代表颜色的hex值，可自行替换，不限制大小写，但是不带有“#”。
​        在一个对话中，可以使用多个颜色标签，颜色标签可嵌套且可任意设置要指定颜色的文字，示例如下：
allclear()
msgboxon()

--在一句话中显示多个颜色的文字
text("[c=FF0000]红[/c][c=00FF00]绿[/c][c=0000FF]蓝[/c]")
textcl()

--人物名也可以制定特定颜色，颜色标签嵌套且可任意设置要指定颜色的文字
text("[c=DDCAB3]丽塔[/c]","麻烦的[c=FF0000]事[/c]交给我，不能脏了您的手。")

显示背景​        PGM支持的图片格式有jpeg、png和bmp三种格式。但单张图片的横、竖分辨率不能超过512像素，这是由于PSP自身的硬件条件限制，无法改变。加载横、竖分辨率超过512的图片都将导致PSP实机测试时死机。
​        在PGM中，显示、播放大部分资源都需要对其进行编号，背景图片的编号只有2个，即1或2；立绘图片的编号有32个，但有某些特殊编号被保留用作显示系统相关图片，保留编号将在后续详细说明。
​        PGM中图片的坐标原点为图片左上角。两张图片重叠时可以用图片处理软件中图层概念来理解，图片编号大的覆盖在图片编号小的图片上。背景图片，即bg处于最底层，文字处于最顶层，而立绘处于中间，而文字对话框处于文字和立绘之间。

显示背景图片​        背景图片在图层级别上低于立绘图片，也就是说，显示时背景图片会显示在立绘图片下方。
显示背景图片命令如下：
--显示背景图片
_bg(number,file,effect,time)
bgxy(number,dx,dy)
bgon(number)

以上命令可以显示一张背景图片，其中：
第一行：
_bg(number,file,effect,time)：代表加载图片，此图片已经被加载到内存中，但未显示。
_bg：加载背景图片的命令，此命令显示的图片效果更好，不会使图片出现“水波纹”，默认已启用“IMG_8888”。
number：代表图层编号，bg只能有两个图层编号，即1或2。显示背景的三行命令中，图片的number是一样的。
file：代表你要加载的背景图片的全文件名，包括其格式，而且还需要带上英文引号，例如：”bg_01.jpg”。
effect：代表效果编号，一共有6个：0，立刻显示，无效果；1，淡入；2，淡出；3，震动；4，遮片（顺时针）；5，遮片（逆时针）。
time：代表效果的持续时间。PGM中，1000为1秒。bg一般淡入淡出都是1000。
IMG_XXXX：此变量非必填，可以设置显示质量，_bg命令默认为IMG_8888，IMG_8888代表以画质最高形式显示。
第二行：
bgxy(number,dx,dy)：代表你想把已经加载的图片显示到屏幕的什么位置，若显示背景图片时不使用此命令，背景图片默认被加载到(0,0)位置。
bgxy：设置你要显示背景图片在屏幕上的位置
number：代表图层编号，此处图层编号需与_bg命令中图层编号一致。
dx、dy：代表你想显示图片位置的横、纵坐标。
第三行：
bgon(number)：显示图片命令。
bgon：此命令为显示图片命令，缺少此命令，图片不会显示。
number：代表图层编号，此处图层编号需与_bg命令中图层编号一致。

关闭背景图片​        关闭背景图片命令有两个，bgoff()和bgnull()，下面讲解两个命令的异同：
--关闭背景图片，但不在内存中清除。
bgoff(number)

--关闭背景图片，并在内存中清除图片。
bgnull(number)

number：代表你想关闭的背景图片的编号。
bgoff：命令多用于暂时的关闭背景图片，且不需要清除背景图片的情况。此命令关闭的图片不需要重新加载即可再次通过bgon命令显示。应用场景可以是关闭背景图片，然后不显示任何背景图片，然后紧接着需要再次显示此背景图片的情况。
bgnull：命令是关闭图片的同时也一同在内存中清除图片。可以有效地防止图片加载过多爆内存的情况。因此我绝大多数情况下都会使用bgnull来关闭背景图片。

显示立绘​        立绘，多指人物立绘。但有时也有其他用法，比如需要在显示一些特别字体的文字，GB2312编码无法涵盖，此时就可以将想显示的特殊文字通过编辑为图片的方式，以图片的形式在PGM中显示。
显示立绘图片--显示人物立绘
_fg(number,file,effect,time)
fgxy(number,dx,dy)
fgon(number)

第一行：
_fg(number,file,effect,time)：代表加载立绘图片，此图片已经被加载到内存中，但未显示。
此命令也可以添加IMG_8888选项以提高立绘显示的画质，但画质提升的效果仅在立绘有透明通道时效果明显，可有效消除“水波纹”现象。添加后的代码为“_fg(number,file,effect,time,IMG_8888)”，添加后会加大内存占用，使用时需谨慎。
number：代表图层编号，fg有32个图层编号，但某些编号可能被某些系统图片占用。显示立绘的三行命令中，图片的number是一样的。
file：代表你要加载的立绘图片的全文件名，包括其格式，而且还需要带上英文引号，例如：”fg_01.jpg”。
effect：代表效果编号，一共有6个：0，立刻显示，无效果；1，淡入；2，淡出；3，震动；4，遮片（顺时针）；5，遮片（逆时针）。
time：代表效果的持续时间。PGM中，1000为1秒。fg一般淡入淡出都是200。

关闭立绘图片关闭立绘图片命令有两个，fgoff()和fgnull()，两个命令的异同可参考bgoff()和bgnull()。

播放视频​        PGM也可以播放视频，不过其对视频的格式有特殊要求。PGM只支持pmp格式的视频，pmp是Sony PSP特有的视频格式。关于其制作方法请详见我的博文。
​        由于PGM的特性，如果不在播放音频之前播放一遍视频的话，播放音频是无效的。简单来说，你移植的游戏中如果需要播放音频，那么就必须要在整个工程的开头首先播放一次视频，只有这样，音频才能有效。
--播放视频
video(file)


播放音频​        PGM支持wav、mp3两种格式的音频文件。支持同时播放2个mp3和4个wav。不同格式通常有不同的用法。PGM中的音频可分为三大类：背景音乐、音效、人物语音。
​        通常背景音乐使用mp3格式的音频，音效和人物语音使用wav格式的音频。

播放音频代码示例如下：
--播放背景音乐
bgm(file)

--播放音效
sound(file)

--播放人物语音
voice(file)

​        上述bgm、sound和voice命令虽然没有编号，但其实其默认的编号都是1，在停止播放时需要音频的编号。

停止播放音频​        一般只有背景音乐会出现需要停止的情况。因为音效和人物语音一般都不需要在播放过程中停止。
--停止播放背景音乐
bgmstop(number)

--停止播放音效
soundstop(number)

--停止播放人物语音
voicestop(number)

​        音频是PGM资源中，内存占用很大的一部分，对于使用完毕的音频要及时将其从内存中清除。音效一般占用较小，影响不大，不需要清除。人物语音播放完毕后会自动清除。
--清除背景音乐
bgmnull(number)

三、中级用法标题界面和菜单界面标题界面​        标题界面是指游戏开始之后，玩家进行游戏功能选择的位置。一般游戏的标题界面主要包含几个选项：“开始游戏”，“读取存档”，“CG/音乐鉴赏”和“退出游戏”等选项，这些选项不全是固定的，但是“开始游戏”这个选项是一定要有的，否则玩家无法进行游戏。

开始游戏后，系统在am_start.ev中读取配置信息，一般会在am_start.ev文件里配置游戏开始前的一些宣传信息或游戏启动动画。之后jump到title.ev。

菜单及系统界面菜单界面配置文件​        若需要对界面的选项排布做更改，如增加或删除选项，就需要处理界面脚本。界面脚本位于src文件夹中，配置文件的文件名为ce_init.lua，此文件使用任何文本编辑器都可直接打开。
打开后，主要可更改的配置如下：

游戏信息
​        首先是游戏信息部分，针对此部分的更改将影响游戏的外部属性，如游戏名称、游戏版本、游戏存档详细信息，游戏存档数量、游戏存档方式和系统声音选项。
-- ================================================================
-- game msg var
-- ================================================================
-- 如果想使用psp官方存档,GAME_NAME不得超过12个字符
GAME_NAME = "PGMCE"
GAME_VERSION = 1.0
GAME_MSG = "PocketGameMaker-ConvertedEdition-"
GAME_SAVELISTSIZE = 8
GAME_SAVEMODE = PGMPSP
CreatePGMSaveFolder()

DEFAULT_SOUND = "system/nil.wav"
CERTAIN_SOUND = "system/certain.wav"
CANCEL_SOUND = "system/cancel.wav"

GAME_NAME：此选项为游戏名称，若想要在PSP官方存档模式下更改游戏名称，更改后的名称不能超过12个字符。但游戏名称并不是只可以在此处设置，在游戏的SFO文件中也可以更改游戏名称
GAME_VERSION：游戏版本，游戏的版本号可以在此处设置。也可以在游戏的SFO文件中设置。
GAME_MSG：游戏存档信息，此处显示的信息是每次存档时，对存档的一个备注信息，用于区分存档。但是技术有限，在本教程中我并未掌握如何动态的设置此信息。此处设置为“PocketGameMaker-ConvertedEdition-”是静态的，有多个存档时，从外表看，每个存档都一样，起不到区分存档的作用。
GAME_SAVELISTSIZE：游戏存档数量，此处可以设置游戏的最大存档数量，默认为8。如果认为数量不够的话，可自行设置。
GAME_SAVEMODE：存档方式，可选的存档方式有两种。

PSP官方存档模式：将此处设置为PGMPSP，是PSP官方的存档模式，一般我移植的游戏都使用此模式；

PGM存档模式：将此处设置为PGMPC，使用PGM内部的存档。


**CreatePGMSaveFolder()**：系统创建存档的函数，此处不可更改！
DEFAULT_SOUND：游戏中除“确定”和“取消”按键的音效，可自行更改。
CERTAIN_SOUND：游戏中确定键的音效，可自行更改。
CANCEL_SOUND：游戏中取消键的音效，可自行更改。

对话框设定
​        针对对话框的设定主要包括：对话框图片、对话框图层数、对话框原点横坐标和对话框原点纵坐标。
-- 对话框设定
MSGBOX = "msgbox01.png"
MSGBOX_NUM = 10
MSGBOX_DX = 0
MSGBOX_DY = 272-116

MSGBOX：对话框图片，此处可以设置哪个图片作为对话框。此处的图片以IMG_8888方式显示，支持带有透明通道。
MSGBOX_NUM：对话框图层数，对话框从图片大类上讲属于fg大类，也就是属于立绘，具体其占用哪个图层可以自行决定，个人建议设置在20至25之间，这样既在单一章节给人物立绘预留了充足的图层数（当设置为20时，给人物立绘预留了10多个图层），又给其他功能预留了图层。
MSGBOX_DX：对话框原点横坐标，设置对话框原点横向距离上屏幕边缘的像素数量。
MSGBOX_DY：对话框原点纵坐标，设置对话框原点纵向距离上屏幕边缘的像素数量。

名字设定
​        此处的名字是指游戏剧情脚本中，涉及人物名字的对话中人物名字的显示位置。
-- 名字设定
MSGNAME_NUM = 32
MSGNAME_DX = MSGBOX_DX+65
MSGNAME_DY = MSGBOX_DY+33-DIALOG_FONT_HEIGHT

MSGNAME_NUM：人物名字的图层数，默认设置为了32。
MSGNAME_DX：人物名字的原点横坐标，默认设置是在对话框原点横坐标上向右偏移65个像素。这种设置的好处是使名字和对话框有固定的距离，便于调整。人物的名字一般都在对话框的左上方，当更改对话框原点坐标时，名字原点的坐标也跟着一起移动，二者之间形成一种绑定状态，不会出现对话框和名字错位等现象。
MSGNAME_DY：人物名字的原点纵坐标，默认设置是在对话框原点纵坐标基础上减去对话文本的文字高度又向下偏移33个像素。关于名字原点的纵坐标可以自行设置，不同游戏有不同的排布方式。

对话文本设定
​        对话文本就是剧情脚本中被text()所包裹，需要在游戏过程中显示的文本。可以设置的选项有：对话文本原点的横坐标、对话文本原点的纵坐标、对话文本的单行最大文字数和对话文本的最大行数。
-- 对话文本设定
MSGTEXT_DX = MSGBOX_DX+35
MSGTEXT_DY = MSGBOX_DY+40
MSGTEXT_LINELEN = 50
MSGTEXT_LINEMAX = 3

MSGTEXT_DX：对话文本原点横坐标，默认为在对话框原点横坐标基础上向右偏移35个像素。
MSGTEXT_DY：对话文本原点纵坐标，默认为在对话框原点纵坐标基础上向下偏移40个像素。
MSGTEXT_LINELEN：对话文本的单行最大文字数，默认为50，即单行最大可显示50个文字，超出50个的文字将自动切换至下一行显示。建议自行根据游戏进行调整。
MSGTEXT_LINEMAX：对话文本的最大行数，默认为3。单次显示对话文本的最大行数，若单次文本量很大，3行都不能完全1次显示，则会自动清屏，在下一个对话中显示剩余的文本。

若设置为“1”，则5个按钮的排列方式是左右排成一排。



支线菜单设定
​        当游戏进行到特定阶段时，可能有需要玩家进行选择的情况。根据选择的不同，游戏剧情也可能会有不同，这就是支线菜单。
-- ================================================================
-- ramus module constant var
-- ================================================================
RAMUS_ICON = "hand_icon02.png"
RAMUS_ICON_DX = 120
RAMUS_ICON_DY = 74
RAMUS_ICON_STEP_DX = 0
RAMUS_ICON_STEP_DY = 35
RAMUS_BUTTON_BG = "ramus_bg.png"
RAMUS_BUTTON_BG_DX = 60
RAMUS_BUTTON_BG_DY = 60
RAMUS_BUTTON_DX = 94
RAMUS_BUTTON_DY = 68
RAMUS_BUTTON_STEP_DX = 0
RAMUS_BUTTON_STEP_DY = 35
RAMUS_BUTTON_ICON_MODE = 2
RAMUS_SOUND = DEFAULT_SOUND

RAMUS_ICON：支线指示图标，指示当前选定了哪个选项。
RAMUS_ICON_DX、RAMUS_ICON_DY：支线指示图标的初始横、纵坐标。
RAMUS_ICON_STEP_DX、RAMUS_ICON_STEP_DY：支线指示图标的步进量。
RAMUS_BUTTON_BG：支线选项背景，此背景的处理方式与“标题界面选项图片”处理方法一致。图片上部为未选定状态，图片下部为选定状态。




RAMUS_BUTTON_BG_DX、RAMUS_BUTTON_BG_DY：支线选项背景的横、纵坐标。
RAMUS_BUTTON_DX、RAMUS_BUTTON_DY：支线选项的横、纵坐标。
RAMUS_BUTTON_STEP_DX、RAMUS_BUTTON_STEP_DY：支线选项的步进量。
RAMUS_BUTTON_ICON_MODE：支线指示图标的模式，同“功能按钮控制模式”。设置“2”为上下移动，设置“1”为左右移动。

游戏系统设定菜单​        在PGM中，游戏系统设定菜单主要包含以下几个功能：“设置背景音乐大小”、“设置背景音效大小”和“设置阅读速度”。此处设置的阅读速度是指正常模式下游戏文本的显示速度。
​        此菜单也可以自行设置，但目前精力有限，并没有研究如何对其进行设置。





标签跳转​        PGM可以实现在一个剧情脚本内设置标签，然后跳转到特定标签的功能。此功能多用于有选择的位置，如游戏中根据不同的选项有不同的进展，或者是标题菜单等。
标签跳转的命令如下：
--标签跳转命令
goto(*lable01)

......  --此处的点代表剧情脚本中的其他内容
......  --此处的点代表剧情脚本中的其他内容
......  --此处的点代表剧情脚本中的其他内容

*lable01  --要跳转到的标签位置

​        在剧情脚本中使用标签跳转命令后，程序会直接跳过goto(*lable01)和*lable01之间的内容，二者之间的任何内容都不会被执行。

脚本跳转​        脚本跳转是指“剧情脚本之间的跳转”或者是“程序脚本和剧情脚本之间的跳转”。但大多数情况前者应用场景较多。
​        剧情脚本之间的跳转，当游戏内容过多时，可以将游戏剧情脚本拆分成不同的章节，从上一章跳转到下一章时，就需要使用脚本跳转命令。
--脚本跳转命令
jump(file)

--jump命令后的命令不会被程序执行，因为当前已经在下一个制定的脚本中了。
text("本文本不会被显示。")

​        此命令绝大多数情况会被使用在剧情脚本末尾，因为一旦执行了这个命令，程序就会跳转到指定的剧情脚本，而不再执行当前脚本中此命令后命令。

分支选项--分支选项代码
drawramus("分支选项1",*lable01","分支选项2",*lable02)

*lable01
text("你选择了选项一")
textcl()

*lable02
text("你选择了选项二")
textcl()

分支选项可以使用多个。

title: Ubuntu删除旧内核
content:
为什么要删除旧内核旧的内核在系统中占用了不必要的空间，为了不影响系统的速度，所以要删除旧的内核。但是有时候会由于新内核不稳定或版本太高，使得某些软件不能正常工作，删除旧内核使用新内核也存在一定风险。另外需要注意，千万不要删错内核。如果对自己的操作没有把握就不要删。


操作步骤1.删除前需确定目前所使用的内核版本。使用的命令是：查看当前系统的相关信息。“$”后面的是代码，每次执行一行。
$ uname -a
显示的信息 从中可以看出系统的内核版本是4.18.0-10-generic
$ Linux xxx.xxx 4.18.0-10-generic #11-Ubuntu SMP Thu Oct 11 15:13:55 UTC 2018 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux


2.搜索带有linux的文件，输入：
$ dpkg --get-selections | grep linux

如果有旧的内核，会在输入上面的命令后出现不同于当前版本的内核。我由于没有旧的内核，所以下面的显示信息中没有其他版本内核。
$ binutils-x86-64-linux-gnu                       install
$ console-setup-linux                             install
$ libselinux1:amd64                               install
$ linux-base                                      install
$ linux-firmware                                  install
$ linux-generic                                   install
$ linux-headers-4.18.0-10                         install
$ linux-headers-4.18.0-10-generic                 install
$ linux-headers-generic                           install
$ linux-image-4.18.0-10-generic                   install
$ linux-image-generic                             install
$ linux-libc-dev:amd64                            install
$ linux-modules-4.18.0-10-generic                 install
$ linux-modules-extra-4.18.0-10-generic           install
$ util-linux                                      install


3.删除指定版本内核，如果你执行完上述命令，发现了不同版本的内核。需要执行如下命令：
remove后面复制上你上面发现的旧版本内核的名字
$ sudo apt-get remove
至此，旧版本内核删除完毕。你也可以再执行一下下面的命令，检查一下效果。
$ dpkg --get-selections | grep linux

清除残留如果发现旧版本内核有残留文件。请使用如下自动卸载和清除命令。
自动卸载命令
$ sudo apt-get autoremove

自动清除命令
$ sudo apt-get autoclean

如果执行上述命令后，发现还是有残留的文件。请执行如下命令，对残留文件进行指定删除。
remove后面复制上你上面发现的残留文件的名字
$ sudo apt-get remove

title: 制作at3格式的音乐
content:
at3格式的音乐是什么at3格式的音乐是索尼开发的一种音乐文件格式。我所知道的使用at3格式音乐的只有PSP。
此教程针对64位电脑。我之前按照能找到的教程试过，都不好用，然后在reddit找到了64位系统的解决方案。现在分享给大家。
reddit原帖：[Guide] Create Custom Sounds for Games (SND0.AT3)




方法步骤1.首先下载GoldWave，软件版本应该影响不大。不过如果最新版不好用的话，我的建议版本为5.25。
2.其次，要下载到at3音频编码器。这个好找。
3.在下载好的AT3文件里找到后缀名为 “acm” 的文件（通常这个文件名字是 ”atrac3.acm“），然后复制到目录 C:\Windows\SysWOW64\
4.新建一个文本文档，然后复制以下文字进去：
Windows Registry Editor Version 5.00[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Wow6432Node\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Drivers32]"msacm.atrac3acm"="atrac3.acm"[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Wow6432Node\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\drivers.desc]"atrac3.acm"="Sony ATRAC3 ACM"

5.保存上面的那个文本文档，修改文件名为 atrac3.reg （这里也改变了文件种类，已经不是文本了，是注册表文件），然后把它复制到 C:\Windows\SysWOW64\ ，运行一次这个文件，重启电脑。这样at3格式的音乐就能正常在电脑上播放了。

title: 使用软件调节Ubuntu的屏幕亮度
content:
由于对Linux系统感兴趣，前段时间给笔记本装上了双系统。主用Windows10，备用Ubuntu。
起初Ubuntu安装十分顺利，按照网上的教程下载镜像、用U盘制作安装盘、分区、进入BIOS调整启动顺序。一切正常。Ubuntu启动成功。可就是有一件事不太完美。不能调节屏幕亮度，屏幕十分亮瞎眼。


具体表现就是按笔记本上的快捷键Fn和相关组合键调节亮度时，亮度条确实在动，但屏幕实际亮度没有变化。
我之前试过使用命令行和修改设置文件的办法，但是都没有用。其中有一种方法使用之后，电脑提示我没有相关的brightness文件。
上网搜索解决办法。搜索关键字 “Ubuntu 没有brightness文件 调节亮度”，找到了这篇文章《Ubuntu16.04/16.10下缺失brightness设置，解决屏幕亮度调节的问题》。
文章里的描述和我的情况很相似。按照文章里的操作安装了一个调节亮度的软件——brightness-controler。软件是图形界面的，很友好。
在这里我写上安装的一些指令。以作备份之用，想看更详细的描述请前往上面的文章查看。
“$”后面的是代码，每次执行一行。
$ sudo add-apt-repository ppa:apandada1/brightness-controller
$ sudo apt-get update
$ sudo apt-get install brightness-controller
启动方式
$ brightness-controler       
安装完毕后可以在全部程序里看到图标，在图标上点击鼠标右键，有选项可将其附在菜单栏，方便随时调节。

这个方法并不会在每次开机时自动设置亮度，因此你要每次手动设置。还有就是我遇到过亮度自动失效的情况，比如通过浏览器点开一个视频，或者通过右上角的设置锁屏的时候，屏幕亮度都会回到最高。
